newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai stocks seen easing on finance sector woes.
newsitem.headline: Thai stocks seen easing on finance sector woes.

text.p: Thai stocks are seen edging down on Thursday hampered by continued market concerns surrounding the finance sector and doubts surrounding the future of Finance One Plc, analysts said.
The SET Index rose 2.90 points to 496.03 on Wednesday. The SET 50 rose 0.37 points to 35.27.
"I expect the Fin One situation will continue to weigh on the market as sales of financial sector shares may drag the market down," said one senior foreign analyst.
The subscription book to a planned rights issue by ailing Finance One Plc, once the country's most successful finance firm, closed on Wednesday with doubt surrounding the subscription.
The low weighting of the finance sector in the market as a whole may pare losses and there is continuing foreign interest in telecoms, energy and banking stocks, analysts said.

"I think there is a case for saying that apart from technical reasons for exposure to this market, the risk of being underweight ahead of a possible ultra-rapid bounce are there," he said.--James Mclean (662) 652-0642
